data.title: 'Hanginâ On' by ERNEST & Morgan Wallen â Lyrics & Meaning
data.meta_description: Song lyrics and meaning for Ernest and Morgan Wallen's 2024 single, âHangin' On,â from Ernest's recently released album, Nashville, Tennessee, released via Big Loud Records.
data.text:
Ernest feat. Morgan Wallen - âHangin' Onâ

Label: Big Loud Records

Release Date: April 12th, 2024

Producer: Joey Moi

Songwriters: Ernest Keith Smith, Grady Block, Rhys Rutherford, Jacob Durrett & Rafe Tenpenny

Featuring 26 tracks that are somehow all must-listens, Nashville, Tennessee by Ernest â the country croonerâs third studio album â hit all music streaming services on April 12, instantly making waves with one track in particular: 'Hanginâ On' featuring Morgan Wallen.

While the record features collaborations with some of the biggest names on the country music scene as of late â from Lainey Wilson to Jelly Roll to HARDY and beyond â fans were especially thrilled to see yet another duet between Ernest and Wallen after the success of their previous duets, 'Flower Shops' and 'Cowgirls,' which has made waves on both social media and streaming services.

With two top notch collaborations, this third collaboration could not have come at a better time.

While 'Flower Shops' is known for being on the sadder side and 'Cowgirls' is best described either a pregame or party anthem, 'Hanginâ On' is a stark contrast from the songs that country music lovers know and love from this duo, showing off a much more angry, aggressive and â for lack of a better term â badass side of both stars.

Beginning with some chilling guitar chords, 'Hanginâ On' blends into a catchy beat-driven tune, utilizing the trap-leaning sound that is heard within 'Cowgirls,' as well as Wallenâs song 'Broadway Girls'.

Layered behind Ernest and Wallenâs vocals â which combine the smooth versalitility of R&B and rap with a touch of country twang â the overall sound has been compared to Post Malone and his country music career so far.

"Bar light open

And I was hoping

Iâd find a flame that burns just like you

Neon shadows across the dancefloor

That spun you âround just like you wanted me to

Whiskey shot whiskey shot

Get me drunk take me home

Thatâs what you were tellinâ me now

Morning came I woke up

Now youâre gone for good

And Iâm losing my sleep"

Throughout, Ernest and Wallen try to find clarity after being ghosted by a love interest.

The first verse sets the scene of the evening, sharing that the narrator entered the bar that fateful night to âfind a flame that burns just like you,â ultimately achieving this goal. Describing a dance floor with âneon shadows,â it's implied that this bar is a honky tonk, where the narrator later dances with a beautiful woman and takes whiskey shot after whiskey shot, prior to drunkenly leaving together.

While this rowdy night out is seemingly smooth sailing, things take a turn for the worse in the second half of the verse, as the narrator appears to get ghosted by the woman who he left the honky tonk with. âMorning came I woke up / Now youâre gone for good / And Iâm losing my sleep,â Ernet sings, prior to delving into the chorus of the track alongside Wallen.

"You left me hanginâ on

By a thread of them blue jeans

Baby now Iâm wondering where it all went wrong

Got me hanging on to some Jack and some Jim Beam

Tryinâ hard as hell just to get you gone

But itâs takinâ too long

For this heartache to give up

Now I canât get up

Off of this old barstool

You left me hanginâ on

By a thread of them blue jeans

Baby now Iâm wondering where it all went wrong

You got me hanginâ on on

Got me hanginâ on"

Waking up devastated, the narrator is now racking his brain trying to figure out what he did wrong to make this woman leave without a trace, coping with the pain the only way that a broken-hearted country boy knows how: alcohol.

âGot me hanging on to some Jack and some Jim Beam / Tryinâ hard as hell just to get you gone,â Ernest and Wallen sing in the chorus, implying that they are using excess amounts of alcohol to try to numb the pain and forget about the heartache that they are feeling.

"Girl I canât take anymore

No I canât take that goodbye

Canât pick my heart off the floor

Cause you got me some kind of high

I never felt but I liked it

Didnât try to fight it

Howâs I supposed to know

The next day Iâd feel like dyinâ

Whiskey shot whiskey shot

Get me drunk take me home

I wish you were tellinâ me now

In my head I see you in my bed

But I know that itâs all just a dream"

In the second verse, taken over by Wallen, the narrator is feeling helpless, admitting that he âcanât take anymoreâ and âcanât take that goodbye,â seemingly left with a shattered heart.

Gushing that this girl was truly one in a million â mimicking âsome kind of highâ that he has never felt before â he was unaware of the heartache that he would have to endure after she abandoned him the following morning.

In the second half of this verse, the narrator reminisces on the night he met this woman, before realizing that trying to relive that evening is nothing but a dream.

To follow, Ernest and Wallen team up for two more choruses to close out the track.

While neither artist has spoken out about 'Hanginâ On,' Ernest teased a solo version of the track via TikTok in May, instantaneously garnering an excited reaction from fans in the comment section of the post.

âDudeeeeeee if I could like this 100000000000x I would,â one TikTok user gushed. Another dished, âYessss!!!! This song is ð¥ð¥ð¥â âRelease this ASAP,â a third TikTok user demanded.

While the 'Last Night' singer was not announced as a collaborator on the track at the time, some fans speculated that the duo would pair up for 'Hanginâ On' based on the sound of the song alone, with one viewer asking âIs this Morganâs beat?â in the comment section of the post, with another replying âHe's gonna be on it.â

Despite speculation leading up to its release, Ernest and Wallen have kept quiet about the brand new tune before it dropped on April 12.
